text:
The list is good, but entails a lot of manual work to review and apply. 
Keeping systems updated are usually not an issue, just getting all updates from
2015 forward on refreshed or new systems is the challenge. 
We use OSDupdate and powershell to pull down all of the applicable updates and
repackage Office 2016 to ensure all of our new/re-imaged devices start with a
full set of updates /patches. 
You can use it to pull in all of the applicable updates and use your own script
to install also. 
Even a manual install will have all of the current updates by placing the .msp’s
in the updates folder for initial install. 
It’s worth the time to review and setup. 
Overview - OSDUpdate (osdeploy.com)
 
https://osdupdate.osdeploy.com/docs/archive/office-deployment-and-osdupdate
 
https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/OSDUpdate/21.12.14.1
 
Fairly reliable internal source stated to our company that Office 2016 having no
new roll-ups or Service packs was by design as it pushed companies to use M365
and click to run technologies with regular new base builds to use. 
Ernie

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Office 2016 Patching
